p: A married, 51-year-old female felt the lump in the right breast 2 weeks prior to consultation. She had no significant medical history. Physical examination revealed a palpable mass at 6 o'clock in the right breast with a size of 2.0 Ã— 1.5 cm, with no obvious lump in the left breast. The lump felt hard, with an indistinct border, no tenderness, and was movable. There was no skin involvement, orange peel, skin dimpling, or swollen lymph nodes under either armpit. Her body mass index (BMI) was 23.4 kg/m 2.
